Package XXLChess

Class Board

java.lang.Object
XXLChess.Board
public class Board extends Object
Board represents the game board of the game. It handles the movements of pieces and the interaction between pieces and players.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(PlayerAgent white, PlayerAgent black)
      Constructs a new Board object. Initializes the board with empty tiles, and associates the player agents with their respective colors.
      Parameters:
      white - the player agent who controls the white pieces.
      black - the player agent who controls the black pieces.

  • Method Details

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the Tile object at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile.
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile.
      Returns:
      the Tile object at the specified position, null if the position is out of bounds.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(int x, int y)
      Returns the Piece object at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile.
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile.
      Returns:
      the Piece object at the specified position, null if there is no piece or the position is out of bounds.

    • getPieceOwner

      public PlayerAgent getPieceOwner(Piece piece)
      Returns the PlayerAgent who owns the specified piece.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece that you want to check ownership.
      Returns:
      the PlayerAgent who owns the piece.

    • getAgentByColor

      public PlayerAgent getAgentByColor(Piece.Color color)
      Returns the player agent of the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the pieces that the player controls.
      Returns:
      the PlayerAgent who controls the pieces of the specified color.

    • jumpingMove

      public Set<Tile> jumpingMove(Tile source, int[][] directions)
      Computes and returns the set of Tiles that can be reached by "jumping" from the source Tile in the specified directions.
      Parameters:
      source - the Tile from which the moves start.
      directions - an array of 2-element arrays, each representing a direction in which a move can be made.
      Returns:
      the set of Tiles that can be reached by jumping from the source Tile in the specified directions.

    • linearMove

      public Set<Tile> linearMove(Tile sourceTile, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Computes and returns the set of Tiles that can be reached by moving linearly from the source Tile.
      Parameters:
      sourceTile - the Tile from which the moves start.
      xOffset - the change in x-coordinate for each step of the move.
      yOffset - the change in y-coordinate for each step of the move.
      Returns:
      the set of Tiles that can be reached by moving linearly from the source Tile.

    • clone

      public Board clone()
      Clones the current board state and returns a new Board object with the same state.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a new Board object that has the same state as the current board.
